tell me about the.answer: Nalanda library at IIT Ropar is the central hub for academic resources. It has 25,000+ books, thousands of e-journals, reference works, databases (Scopus, Web of Science, MathSciNet, etc.), research monographs, and digital tools like Turnitin, Grammarly, and Overleaf. It uses Koha ILMS, RFID technology, OPAC search, and provides extensive research support services.

library timing.answer: Library is open 24/7 throughout the year. Staff are available from 9:00 AM to 2:00 AM daily. During exam periods, staff hours may be extended. Self-service kiosks are available 24/7 for book issue/return.

fine policy.answer: Fine & Penalty Policy (Nalanda Library, IIT Ropar): ‚Çπ2.00 per day for the first week after the due date. The fine amount doubles every subsequent week (‚Çπ4.00, ‚Çπ8.00, ‚Çπ16.00, etc.). After four weeks of non-return/non-renewal, the member's library membership is temporarily deactivated and fines continue to accrue until the item is returned. Lost or damaged books must be replaced with the latest edition or reimbursed at the current price plus a processing fee. Loss of Smart ID card: ‚Çπ300 for first duplicate; charge may double for subsequent replacements. For exact charges and exceptions, contact libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in or check the official site.

technobooth.answer: Technobooth (Digital Learning Hub) in Nalanda Library provides rooms equipped with interactive touch screens (two 65-inch and one 55-inch) for group study, presentations, and digital projects. how to hold a book.answer:
üìö **Proper Book Handling Guidelines:**

‚úÖ **Do:**
‚Ä¢ Handle books with clean, dry hands
‚Ä¢ Open books gently, don't force the spine
‚Ä¢ Support the book's weight when reading
‚Ä¢ Use bookmarks instead of folding pages
‚Ä¢ Keep books away from food and drinks
‚Ä¢ Store books upright on shelves

‚ùå **Don't:**
‚Ä¢ Pull books by the top of the spine
‚Ä¢ Write or highlight in library books
‚Ä¢ Leave books in damp or sunny places
‚Ä¢ Use books as coasters or writing surfaces

**Remember:** Library books are shared resources. Handle them with care so others can enjoy them too! üìñ

what is onos.answer:
üåê **ONOS (Online Network of Shared Resources)**

üìå **Key Features:**
- Access to 30+ publishers' e-resources
- Shared e-journals, e-books, and databases
- Cross-IIT resource sharing

get help from librarian.answer: Get help from librarians for: book searches, database access, citation management, plagiarism checks, and research support. Visit reference desk during 9 AM - 5:30 PM or email libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in anytime.

what is technobooth.answer:
Technobooth (Digital Learning Hub) is a dedicated space in Nalanda Library for group presentations, assignments, digital projects, multimedia content creation, and virtual meetings.

üìå Facilities:
- 3 rooms (each seating 4-6 persons)
- Interactive Touch Screen Monitors (two 65-inch, one 55-inch)
- Usage limited to 2 hours per day

üìå Guidelines:
- Reservation requires in-person visit (no advance bookings)
- Do not lock booth and leave the library
- Use only for tech-related activities (not general study)
- Check-in/check-out with staff is mandatory
- Handle equipment carefully; report damages
- No downloads/installs; save work to cloud (not USBs)
- Maintain low noise during usage
- No food/drinks allowed
- First-time users may need brief training
- Misuse can lead to penalties or ban; users are liable for damages
- Feedback is encouraged to improve the facility

- Handle equipment carefully; report damages
- No downloads/installs; save work to cloud (not USBs)

- No food/drinks allowed
- First-time users may need brief training
- Misuse can lead to penalties or ban; users are liable for damages
- Feedback is encouraged to improve the facility

what facilities are available in library.answer:
Nalanda Library at IIT Ropar provides a wide range of facilities and services:

 **Resources:** 25,000+ books, e-journals, e-books, research monographs, reference works, fiction, competitive books.
üíª **Digital Tools:** Scopus, Web of Science, MathSciNet, SciFinder, Prowess IQ, Grammarly, Overleaf, Turnitin.
üîç **OPAC:** Online Public Access Catalogue for searching, reserving, and tracking books.
üèõÔ∏è **Book Bank:** UG students can borrow one book per semester (6 months).
üñ®Ô∏è **Photocopy/Printing/Scanning:** Available 9 AM-10 PM, charges ‚Çπ1 per page.
üßë‚Äçüéì **Research Support:** Plagiarism checks, citation analysis, workshops, reference services, subject/research guides.
üì° **Institutional Digital Repository (IDR):** Online theses, dissertations, research publications.
üñ•Ô∏è **Technobooth (Digital Learning Hub):** Rooms with interactive touch screens for group work, presentations, and digital projects.
ü™ë **Reading Spaces:** 240+ seating capacity, 24/7 access on the Ground Floor.
 **Reference Section & Leisure Reading:** Includes competitive exam guides, Hindi & English fiction, and faculty-authored books.
üéì **Orientation Programs:** For new students to learn library rules, resources, and tools.
üìë **EDD & ILL Services:** Electronic Document Delivery and Inter-Library Loan for materials not in the library.

üëâ Overall, Nalanda Library provides academic, research, and digital support to help students and faculty succeed.

opac.answer: OPAC: https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in ‚Äî search catalogue, check availability, renew items and place reservations.

borrowing limits.answer: Borrowing limits: Faculty - 12 books (1 semester), Staff - 4 books (1 semester), PhD Scholars - 6 books (4 weeks), PG Students - 5 books (2 weeks), UG Students - 3 books + 1 Book Bank (1 semester). Reference materials and theses are non-circulating.

fines and penalties.answer: Fine & Penalty Policy (Nalanda Library, IIT Ropar): ‚Çπ2.00 per day for the first week after the due date. The fine amount doubles every subsequent week (‚Çπ4.00, ‚Çπ8.00, ‚Çπ16.00, etc.). After four weeks of non-return/non-renewal, the member's library membership is temporarily deactivated and fines continue to accrue until the item is returned. Lost or damaged books must be replaced with the latest edition or reimbursed at the current price plus a processing fee. Loss of Smart ID card: ‚Çπ300 for first duplicate; charge may double for subsequent replacements. For exact charges and exceptions, contact libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in or check the official site.

printing and photocopying.answer: Printing, scanning, and photocopying facilities are available in the library. Charges apply (approx. ‚Çπ1 per side). Users must comply with copyright regulations. Check the helpdesk for current rates.

plagiarism and turnitin.answer: Turnitin similarity checks are available. To request a report, email libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in with details.

electronic document delivery.answer: EDD/ILL: Request articles or chapters via subscriptions@iitrpr.ac.in or libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in. Library arranges delivery under license agreements.

library vision and mission.answer: The vision of Nalanda Library is to support the academic and research needs of IIT Ropar by providing access to information resources, fostering lifelong learning, and creating an inclusive environment that promotes knowledge sharing.

library annual report.answer: Nalanda Library publishes annual reports highlighting achievements, resource growth, and services. Visit https://www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/ for the latest reports and brochures.

library staff and committee.answer: Nalanda Library is managed by professional staff under the guidance of the Library Committee chaired by senior faculty members. Staff details are listed on the library website.

institute smart id card.answer: The Institute-cum-Library Smart ID Card serves as both institute and library ID. It uses RFID technology for book issue and entry. Lost cards incur a ‚Çπ300 fine for first reissue, doubling for each subsequent replacement.

reference service.answer: Library staff assist users in locating materials, literature searches, and citation support through the reference desk or via email at libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in.

subject and research guide.answer: Subject-wise e-resources and research guides are available to help students and researchers locate relevant material efficiently. Check the library‚Äôs resource section for details.

seat booking or article request.answer: Users can book reading seats or request articles via the library portal at https://studyatlib.iitrpr.ac.in.

digital and print periodicals.answer: The library subscribes to digital and select print periodicals across disciplines. Lists are available on the website.

economic and political database.answer: Access to the Economic & Political Database is provided to support humanities and social science research. Check the e-resources page for direct links.

scientometric and patent tools.answer: The library offers access to scientometric tools and patent databases for research evaluation and intellectual property searches.

cds and dvds collection.answer: The library maintains a collection of CDs, DVDs, and other multimedia resources for academic use.

membership for iit ropar students.answer: All registered students, faculty, and staff of IIT Ropar are automatic members of Nalanda Library and can access all facilities using their institute ID.

membership for outsiders.answer: Nalanda Library offers external membership to Academic Institutions, Research Organizations, Government Departments, Industry, and individual academicians, researchers, and alumni. Membership is approved by the institute and requires a refundable security deposit as per library policy.

faculty privileges.answer: Faculty members can issue up to 12 books, request EDD/ILL, and access e-resources off-campus via VPN. They also get Turnitin and Overleaf support.

academic and author tools.answer: Nalanda Library provides institutional access to Grammarly (academic writing support), Overleaf (collaborative LaTeX writing), and Turnitin (plagiarism detection). Contact libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in for account setup or help.

copyright guidelines.answer: Users must adhere to copyright and fair use guidelines. Unauthorized copying or distribution of copyrighted material is strictly prohibited.

institutional repository.answer: IIT Ropar's Institutional Repository hosts theses, dissertations, and publications by faculty and students. It can be accessed through the library website.

vpn and off campus access.answer: Library e-resources can be accessed off-campus through IIT Ropar‚Äôs VPN. Use institute credentials to log in and access subscribed databases and journals remotely.

books arrangement plan.answer: Books are arranged according to the Dewey Decimal Classification (DDC) system on each floor, with signage and directory assistance.

library floor plan.answer: The library has multiple floors ‚Äî ground for circulation and reading, upper floors for reference and periodicals. Detailed plans are displayed near the entrance.

empanelled vendors.answer: Nalanda Library procures books and journals through approved empanelled vendors and subscription agents.

grammarly access.answer: Grammarly access is available for students and researchers through institutional licenses. Contact the library for activation details.

overleaf access.answer: IIT Ropar provides institutional access to Overleaf for collaborative LaTeX writing and research documentation. Visit https://www.overleaf.com/edu/iitrpr.

pressreader access.answer: PressReader offers 7,000+ newspapers and magazines from 130+ countries in 60+ languages. It is accessible through Nalanda Library‚Äôs e-resources portal via campus or VPN access.

library contact details.answer: Nalanda Library, Indian Institute of Technology Ropar, Punjab - 140001. Email: libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in | | Phone: 01881-235183 | Website: https://www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/

library membership.answer: All registered IIT Ropar students, faculty, and staff are automatic members of Nalanda Library. External membership available for approved categories upon request.

what is nalanda library at iit ropar.answer: Nalanda Library (Nalanda Library Information System) is the central academic library of IIT Ropar providing print and digital resources, research support services, institutional repository (DSpace), and e-resource access for students, faculty, and staff.

where is nalanda library located.answer: Nalanda Library is located in the academic complex of IIT Ropar main campus, Rupnagar (Ropar). Contact details and directions are available on the library Contact page.

what sections does the library have.answer: The library includes reading halls, book stacks, reference section, periodicals, digital access area, discussion/group rooms, and reprography/printing facilities.

what is the library vision and mission.answer: The library's mission is to support the institute's teaching, learning and research by providing timely access to quality information resources, services and digital tools, and by promoting information literacy among users.

what e-resources are available at iit ro.answer: IIT Ropar library provides access to e-journals, e-books, databases and research tools including IEEE Xplore, ACM Digital Library, ScienceDirect, SpringerLink, JSTOR, Web of Science, Scopus, MathSciNet, and specialized databases accessed via ONOS and institutional subscriptions.

how do i access e-resources from off cam.answer: Off-campus access to subscribed e-resources is available through the IIT Ropar VPN. Connect to the institute VPN using your credentials, then access library portals or publisher sites as usual.

what is the process to get vpn access fo.answer: VPN access is provided by IIT Ropar IT services. Use institute credentials to set up the VPN client; contact the library helpdesk or IT support for configuration help and troubleshooting.

what is onos for iit ropar.answer: ONOS (Online Network of Shared Resources) is a consortium service providing centralized access to e-resources shared among IITs. IIT Ropar users can access 30+ publisher resources via ONOS (publisher list as on 01.11.2025).

which publishers are included in onos li.answer: ONOS includes major publishers such as AAAS (Science), ACM, ACS, AIAA, AIP, AMS, APS, Annual Reviews, ASCE, ASME, Bentham Science, BMJ, Cambridge University Press, Elsevier (ScienceDirect), Emerald, IEEE, IOP, Oxford, Sage, Springer Nature, Taylor & Francis, Wiley and others (30+ publishers).

how to access onos resources.answer: Access ONOS resources via the IIT Ropar library website (ONOS page) or through publisher links provided there. On-campus access is direct; off-campus requires VPN authentication.

what are the major library rules at iit.answer: Major rules include maintaining silence, keeping mobile phones on silent, no food or drinks inside, carrying institute ID/Smart card, following seat booking rules, and respecting return/renewal policies for issued items.

are bags allowed inside the library.answer: Bags should be left at the designated racks or cloak area; personal large bags are not allowed inside reading areas to maintain space and security.

what is the overdue fine policy.answer: The overdue fine policy is described on the library site and may vary by user category. Typical policies include daily fines for late returns; check 'Overdue & Fine Policy' on the library pages or your OPAC account for exact rates.

what is iit ropar dspace.answer: IIT Ropar's DSpace is the institutional repository that stores and provides open access to theses, dissertations, project reports, faculty publications, conference papers and technical reports. Accessible via the DSpace URL (institutional repository).

how to download phd thesis from dspace.answer: Visit the DSpace repository, search by author/title/department, and download the PDF of available theses. Most theses are open access and can be downloaded without login.

how to submit thesis to dspace.answer: Contact the library helpdesk with the final PDF and metadata (title, abstract, keywords, department). The library staff processes submissions and uploads items to DSpace, assigning a permanent handle.

what services does nalanda library provi.answer: Key services: circulation (issue/return), OPAC search, reference & information service, e-resource access, inter-library loan (ILL), electronic document delivery (EDD), plagiarism check (Turnitin), research support, training/orientation, reprography (printing/scanning), and institutional repository assistance.

does the library offer inter library loa.answer: Yes, Inter Library Loan (ILL) / Document Delivery services are available for material not held by the library. Request via the subscriptions/ILL contact email or library helpdesk.

how can i request an article not availab.answer: Use the 'Request an Article' / EDD form or email the library helpdesk with citation details. The library will attempt to obtain the article via subscriptions or ILL and notify you when available.

how do i contact nalanda library.answer: Contact the library via helpdesk email (libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in) or listed phone numbers. Librarian and subscriptions contacts are available on the Contact page.

where to find library forms and download.answer: Forms and downloadable policies (membership, ILL request, repository submission etc.) are available under the 'Forms' or 'Downloads' section on the library website.

how to check new arrivals in the library.answer: Check the 'New Arrivals' section on the library homepage or search OPAC (opac.iitrpr.ac.in) for recently added books and periodicals.

how to search the library catalogue.answer: Use the OPAC at opac.iitrpr.ac.in to search by title, author, subject, ISBN, or call number. Logged-in users can view issued items, due dates, renew books, and place reservations.

can you tell me tell me about the librar.answer: Nalanda library at IIT Ropar is the central hub for academic resources. It has 25,000+ books, thousands of e-journals, reference works, databases (Scopus, Web of Science, MathSciNet, etc.), research monographs, and digital tools like Turnitin, Grammarly, and Overleaf. It uses Koha ILMS, RFID technology, OPAC search, and provides extensive research support services.

can you tell me fine policy.answer: Fine & Penalty Policy (Nalanda Library, IIT Ropar): ‚Çπ2.00 per day for the first week after the due date. can you tell me technobooth.answer: Technobooth (Digital Learning Hub) in Nalanda Library provides rooms equipped with interactive touch screens (two 65-inch and one 55-inch) for group study, presentations, and digital projects. Each room accommodates 4‚Äì6 persons and can be used for up to 2 hours per day. Facilities include multimedia creation, virtual meetings, and group assignments. Reservation requires an in-person visit to the library helpdesk. Food, drinks, and software installations are not permitted; handle equipment with care.

can you tell me reading room facilities.answer:
Reading Room Facilities:

1. Areas Available:
- Individual study carrels
- Group discussion rooms
- Silent reading zones
- Research scholars area

2. Features:
- Wi-Fi connectivity
- Power outlets
- Good lighting
- Air conditioning

3. Timings:
- Ground Floor: 24/7
- First Floor: 6 AM - 2 AM

4. Rules:
- Maintain silence
- No food/drinks
- Keep phones on silent
- Clean your space

*First-come-first-serve basis for seating*

can you tell me how to search union cata.answer:

1. Visit https://library.iitgn.ac.in/unicat/
2. Enter journal name, ISSN, or keywords
3. View subscription details across IITs
4. Check if IIT Ropar has access
5. Click on publisher link for direct access

This helps you discover e-resources available at IIT Ropar and other IITs.

*For the most updated details, visit the official library website.*

can you tell me how to upload thesis to.answer:
To upload your thesis/dissertation to the Institutional Repository:
1. Submit final thesis in PDF format
2. Contact library staff at libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in
3. Provide thesis metadata (title, abstract, keywords, etc.)
4. Library will upload and assign DOI/Handle
5. Your work becomes openly accessible worldwide

*For the most updated details, visit the official library website.*

can you tell me technobooth facility.answer:
Technobooth (Digital Learning Hub) is a dedicated space in Nalanda Library for group presentations, assignments, digital projects, multimedia content creation, and virtual meetings.

üìå Facilities:
- 3 rooms (each seating 4-6 persons)
- Interactive Touch Screen Monitors (two 65-inch, one 55-inch)
- Usage limited to 2 hours per day

üìå Guidelines:
- Reservation requires in-person visit (no advance bookings)
- Do not lock booth and leave the library
- Use only for tech-related activities (not general study)
- Check-in/check-out with staff is mandatory
- Handle equipment carefully; report damages
- No downloads/installs; save work to cloud (not USBs)
- Maintain low noise during usage
- No food/drinks allowed
- First-time users may need brief training
- Misuse can lead to penalties or ban; users are liable for damages
- Feedback is encouraged to improve the facility

could you describe technobooth rules.answer:
Technobooth (Digital Learning Hub) is a dedicated space in Nalanda Library for group presentations, assignments, digital projects, multimedia content creation, and virtual meetings.

üìå Facilities:
- 3 rooms (each seating 4-6 persons)
- Interactive Touch Screen Monitors (two 65-inch, one 55-inch)
- Usage limited to 2 hours per day

üìå Guidelines:
- Reservation requires in-person visit (no advance bookings)
- Do not lock booth and leave the library
- Use only for tech-related activities (not general study)
- Check-in/check-out with staff is mandatory
- Handle equipment carefully; report damages
- No downloads/installs; save work to cloud (not USBs)
- Maintain low noise during usage
- No food/drinks allowed
- First-time users may need brief training
- Misuse can lead to penalties or ban; users are liable for damages
- Feedback is encouraged to improve the facility

üîç **OPAC:** Online Public Access Catalogue for searching, reserving, and tracking books.
üèõÔ∏è **Book Bank:** UG students can borrow one book per semester (6 months).
üñ®Ô∏è **Photocopy/Printing/Scanning:** Available 9 AM-10 PM, charges ‚Çπ1 per page.
üßë‚Äçüéì **Research Support:** Plagiarism checks, citation analysis, workshops, reference services, subject/research guides.
üì° **Institutional Digital Repository (IDR):** Online theses, dissertations, research publications.
üñ•Ô∏è **Technobooth (Digital Learning Hub):** Rooms with interactive touch screens for group work, presentations, and digital projects.
ü™ë **Reading Spaces:** 240+ seating capacity, 24/7 access on the Ground Floor.
 **Reference Section & Leisure Reading:** Includes competitive exam guides, Hindi & English fiction, and faculty-authored books.
üéì **Orientation Programs:** For new students to learn library rules, resources, and tools.
üìë **EDD & ILL Services:** Electronic Document Delivery and Inter-Library Loan for materials not in the library.

üëâ Overall, Nalanda Library provides academic, research, and digital support to help students and faculty succeed.

can you tell me borrowing limits.answer: Borrowing limits: Faculty - 12 books (1 semester), Staff - 4 books (1 semester), PhD Scholars - 6 books (4 weeks), PG Students - 5 books (2 weeks), UG Students - 3 books + 1 Book Bank (1 semester). Reference materials and theses are non-circulating.

what should I do if the book I borrowed.answer: You will be given two weeks time to replace the same copy of a new book along with the payment of overdue fines if any. If the book is unavailable in the market for purchase, you are required to pay the gross price of the book i.e. price of the book at the time of purchase; along with the fine accumulated.

lost book policy.answer: You will be given two weeks time to replace the same copy of a new book along with the payment of overdue fines if any. If the book is unavailable in the market for purchase, you are required to pay the gross price of the book i.e. price of the book at the time of purchase; along with the fine accumulated.

how to recommend a book for purchase.answer: You can recommend book via your OPAC login portal or by filling out indent form or by scanning QR code (near the helpdesk).

book recommendation process.answer: You can recommend book via your OPAC login portal or by filling out indent form or by scanning QR code (near the helpdesk).

normal time period for receiving suggest.answer: Usually it takes around one month.

how long for book suggestions.answer: Usually it takes around one month.

how do I know whether suggested books ha.answer: You will be informed via email as soon as books will be arrived in the library.

notification for suggested books.answer: You will be informed via email as soon as books will be arrived in the library.

how many books I can suggest.answer: There is no such limit on suggesting the numbers of books.

book suggestion limit.answer: There is no such limit on suggesting the numbers of books.

whom to contact for book procurement que.answer: You can contact Dr. Harpreet Kaur at the library office or email your query to harpreetkaur@iitrpr.ac.in

book procurement contact.answer: You can contact Dr. Harpreet Kaur at the library office or email your query to harpreetkaur@iitrpr.ac.in

procedure of donating books to library.answer: The student can donate the books in the library by submitting the books with their name written on it to Dr. Harpreet Kaur.

book donation process.answer: The student can donate the books in the library by submitting the books with their name written on it to Dr. Harpreet Kaur.

how can I be alerted to new items acquir.answer: Newly procured books are displayed in the new arrival areas. Users can also check for new arrivals though OPAC.

new arrivals notification.answer: Newly procured books are displayed in the new arrival areas. Users can also check for new arrivals though OPAC.

is there any inter library loan facility.answer: Yes, library does provide e-ILL service, allow researchers to request articles and other materials from libraries in India and around the world.

inter library loan.answer: Yes, library does provide e-ILL service, allow researchers to request articles and other materials from libraries in India and around the world.

I want to issue a book but it's damaged.answer: Before issuing the book, the user should check it properly to ensure that there is no damage, if so ,report to library circulation counter, otherwise he/she will be held responsible for damage, if found at the time of returning of the book.

damaged book issue.answer: Before issuing the book, the user should check it properly to ensure that there is no damage, if so ,report to library circulation counter, otherwise he/she will be held responsible for damage, if found at the time of returning of the book.

what is RFID system.answer: RFID technologies facilitate easy lending process and provide security for the library through electronic article surveillance.

RFID technology.answer: RFID technologies facilitate easy lending process and provide security for the library through electronic article surveillance.

can I borrow book from friend's card.answer: It is suggested to bring your own id card to borrow book to avoid any confusion.

borrowing with friend's card.answer: It is suggested to bring your own id card to borrow book to avoid any confusion.

can I return book without card.answer: Yes, you can return book without a card or from somebody else's card.

return without card.answer: Yes, you can return book without a card or from somebody else's card.

can I issue book without card.answer: No, you must carry your card to issue book.

issue without card.answer: No, you must carry your card to issue book.

can I renew book without bringing to lib.answer: Borrower should bring the books physically to the library for renewal.
